title: Sampler, 1800
medium:
Medium: cotton and silk embroidery, cotton foundation
Technique: running and drawnwork stitches on plain weave
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 88 x 82 cm (34 5/8 x 32 5/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Eight people holding sprays arranged in the form of a wreath around "Ann Mack 1800."  Lion, man on horseback, a burrow, headless animal and a building labeled "Melville Castle."

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1800.
1800. Medium: cotton and silk embroidery, cotton foundation
Technique: running and drawnwork stitches on plain weave. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-245.
